intro: Tetragonia expansa, commonly known as New Zealand spinach, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is an annual herb that belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and ability to thrive in arid conditions. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with fleshy, edible leaves that are often used in cooking. It produces small, yellow flowers followed by pale blue or white fruits. Tetragonia expansa is valued for its nutritional content and adaptability to various soil types.
